question.title: "Err: com.android.tools.r8.internal.nc: Absent Code attribute in method that is not native or abstract", when integrating .jar files in Android Studio
question.body:
I’m working on an Android project using the SAM4S ZETA-A50 Android ECR device. I want to integrate a custom plugin with React to print a simple label saying "testing" when a button is clicked on the front end.

The device SDK was provided by the manufacturer, and I need to use it within my project to send print commands to the device. Specifically, I'm trying to integrate the .jar file from the SDK into my Android project.

I’ve included the SHC_ZETA_V1_1.jar in the libs folder and am referencing it in my build.gradle file. However, I encounter the following error when trying to compile an APK:

com.android.tools.r8.internal.nc: Absent Code attribute in method that is not native or abstract

This error only happens when I have the .jar file in the "libs" directory. If I remove the .jar file, the error doesn't occur, and the project compiles without issues.

I’ve included the SHC_ZETA_V1_1.jar from the SDK in my dependencies like this:

repositories {
    flatDir {
        dirs 'libs', '../capacitor-cordova-android-plugins/src/main/libs'
    }
}

dependencies {
   implementation fileTree(include: ['*.jar'], dir: 'libs')
   implementation files('libs\\SHC_ZETA_V1_1.jar')
}

There are no visible errors in my code, and the .jar library I'm using imports the classes correctly. However, when I try to build the APK, I encounter the error mentioned above.
